current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the individual health insurance mandate
			 not apply until the employer health insurance mandate is enforced without
			 exceptions.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Freeing Americans from Inequitable Requirements Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Freeing Americans from Inequitable Requirements Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
requirement that employers with at
			 least 50 full-time equivalent employees provide health coverage for their
			 full-time workers or risk paying a penalty to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text: On July 2, 2013, the Administration delayed until 2015 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
requirement until 2016 for
			 employers with between 50 and 99 full-time equivalent employees to provide
			 qualified health insurance to their employees.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text: On February 10, 2014, the Administration once again delayed the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text:
The Administration lacks the authority to unilaterally change statutorily defined dates in order to
			 delay the implementation of any provision of

If the Administration continues to suspend the penalties for businesses absent any statutory
			 authority, then the penalties for all Americans should be suspended on the
			 basis of fundamental fairness.

The purpose of this Act is to require the suspension of the enforcement of penalties associated
			 with the individual mandate should the Administration unilaterally
			 announce a suspension of the enforcement of penalties for any component of
			 the employer mandate.

header.#text:
Individual health insurance mandate delayed until employer health insurance mandate enforced
			 without exceptions

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following
			 new subsection:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is being
			 applied and administered without any administratively created exceptions.

text.#text: This section shall not apply with respect to any month which begins before the date on which the

header.#text: Delay until employer health insurance mandate enforced without exceptions

text.#text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to months beginning after December 31, 2013.
